com

---

## 🧠 Optional Simpler Method (less precise):

If you don’t want to use IDs:
- You can use the **exact title** of the relation page (e. The ID method is rock-solid. ---

## 🎯 Your Two Paths

### ✅ Option 1: Use UUIDs (like `Areas`)
✔️ Consistent  
✔️ Works for auto-mapping  
❌ Requires manual ID matching if the project doesn’t exist yet  
❌ Can’t create new projects directly from the sheet

### ✅ Option 2: Use Text Input → Staged in a `Comment` Field (Your Idea)
✔️ Easy to enter  
✔️ Keeps your spreadsheet light and human  
✔️ Gives you flexibility to review and link new projects yourself  
✅ **This is the safest and smartest approach right now**

---

## 🪄 Here’s How to Do It

### 🧾 In Your Google Sheet

| Column H (`Projects`) | Column K (`Project Notes`)              |
|------------------------|------------------------------------------|
|                        | Subscription Funnel – add to Projects DB |
|                        | New advisory series – Notion project?    |

➡️ You keep the official `Projects` relation column **empty** or populated only with valid IDs  
➡️ I (Fred) log what we talk about in `Project Notes`

---

### 🔁 In Make

learnings.details:
com that won't involve endless hours of working through issues - the output being 1) a new item in a defined database (avoiding the complicated mapping of Relations fields) and 2) a reminder to update the Relations fields manually after the initial integration creates the new entry
